Number System.question: Which one of the following is not correct?
Number System.c: If p × q is even, then p and q are always even
Number System.comment: p × q even implies at least one is even, not both.

Number System.question: If n is a natural number, then √n is
Number System.d: Either a natural number or an irrational number
Number System.comment: √n is natural for perfect squares, irrational otherwise.

Number System.question: Which one of the following is correct?
Number System.a: Decimal expansion of a rational number is terminating
Number System.b: Decimal expansion of a rational number is non-terminating
Number System.c: Decimal expansion of an irrational number is terminating and non-repeating
Number System.d: Decimal expansion of an irrational number is non-terminating and non-repeating
Number System.comment: Irrational numbers have non-terminating, non-repeating decimals.

Number System.question: All prime numbers up to 110 are multiplied together. What is the unit digit in this product?
What is the value of x for which x, x+1 and x+3 are all prime numbers?
If N²−33, N²−31 and N²−29 are prime numbers, then what is the number of possible values of N, where N is an integer?
Number System.comment: Only pair of prime no. with a gap of 2 is 3,5,7; N²−33=3, N²=36, N=(-6,6) .

Number System.question: The sum of three prime numbers is 100. If one of them exceeds another by 36, then one of the numbers is

Consider the following statements:
1. Of two consecutive integers one is even.
2. Square of an odd integer is of the form 8n +1.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
Number System.comment: Both statements hold true for integers.

Number System.question: Which one of the following rational numbers has non-terminating and repeating decimal expansion?

Consider the following statements in respect of two integers p and q (both >1) which are relatively prime:
1. Both p and q may be odd numbers.
2. Both p and q may be prime numbers.
3. One of p and q may be composite number.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
Number System.comment: All combinations are possible for relatively prime numbers.

Number System.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
Number System.a: The difference of two prime numbers, both greater than 2, is divisible by 2
Number System.b: For two different integers m, n and a prime number p, if p divides the product m x n, then P divides either m or n
Number System.c: If a number is of the form 6n - 1 (n being a natural number), then it is a prime number.
Number System.d: There is only one set of three prime numbers such that there is a gap of 2 between two adjacent prime numbers

Number System.question: 'AB' is a 2 digit prime number where A is not equal to B. If the digits are reversed new number 'BA' is also a prime number. Then find sum of all such numbers.
There are numbers which are co-prime to each other, are such that the product of the first two is 286 and that of the last two is 770. What is the sum of the numbers?
x, y and z are prime numbers and x + y + z = 38. What is the maximum value of x?
N is the smallest three digit prime number. When N is divided by 13, then what will be the remainder?
How many pairs of natural numbers are there such that the difference of their squares is 35?
How many pairs of natural numbers are there such that the difference of their squares is 40?
Suppose n is a positive integer such that n²+48 is a perfect square. What is the number of such n?
What is the sum of all integer values of n for which n²+19n+92 is a perfect square?
The sum of the digits of a number 10^n-1, where n is a natural number, is equal to 3798, then what is the value of n?
The sum of two positive numbers is 14 and difference between their squares is 28, what is the sum of their cubes?
The product of three consecutive positive integers is 15600. Then the sum of the squares of these integers is
The sum of the squares of two natural consecutive odd numbers is 394. The sum of the numbers is
Let a, b and c be the fractions such that a = b + c. If c is divided by a, the result is 1/2. If a + b + c =1, then a - b = ?
If I = a² + b² + c² , where a and b are consecutive integers and c = ab, then I is
Number System.a: An even number and it is not a square of an integer
Number System.b: An odd number and it is a square of an integer

Profit and Loss.question: A shopkeeper sold an article for Rs. 250 and made a profit of 25%. What was the cost price of the article?
A man buys an article for Rs. 150 and sells it for Rs. 180. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 500 and offers a discount of 20%. If he still makes a profit of 25%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 600, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an item at a loss of 10%, but if he had sold it for Rs. 50 more, he would have gained 5%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper buys an item for Rs. 400 and sells it for Rs. 480. What is his profit percentage?
An article is sold for Rs. 300 at a loss of 25%. What was the cost price?
A man buys 12 oranges for Rs. 48 and sells 8 oranges for Rs. 40. What is his profit percentage?
Profit and Loss.comment: CP per orange = 48 / 12 = 4, SP per orange = 40 / 8 = 5, Profit % = (5 - 4) / 4 × 100 = 25%.

Profit and Loss.question: A shopkeeper sells an article at a profit of 15%. If the cost price is Rs. 200, what is the selling price?
A trader marks an article 40% above the cost price and offers a discount of 20%. If the cost price is Rs. 500, what is the profit percentage?
By selling an article for Rs. 800, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 60%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper sells two articles for Rs. 400 each, one at a profit of 25% and the other at a loss of 25%. What is the overall profit or loss percentage?
A man buys an article for Rs. 200 and sells it for Rs. 250. If he had sold it for Rs. 150, what would have been his percentage loss?
A shopkeeper sells an article for Rs. 360 and makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader buys an article for Rs. 600 and sells it at a loss of 10%. What is the selling price?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 1000 and gives a discount of 15%. If he makes a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 450, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
A man buys 10 pens for Rs. 50 and sells them at Rs. 6 each. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a profit of 25%. If the cost price and selling price are increased by Rs. 100 each, the profit percentage becomes 20%. What is the original cost price?
A trader sells an article at a profit of 15%. If he had sold it for Rs. 23 more, he would have gained 20%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper buys an article for Rs. 800 and marks it up by 25%. After offering a discount of 10%, what is his profit percentage?
By selling an article for Rs. 240, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an article for Rs. 360 at a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper buys 12 kg of rice for Rs. 360 and sells it at Rs. 32 per kg. What is his profit percentage?
A man sells an article at a profit of 25%. If the cost price is Rs. 320, what is the selling price?
A shopkeeper sells an article for Rs. 600 and makes a profit of 20%. If he wants to make a profit of 25%, what should be the selling price?
A trader buys an article for Rs. 500 and sells it for Rs. 600. If he had bought it for Rs. 400, what would be his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a loss of 15%. If the selling price is Rs. 340, what is the cost price?
A man buys 10 books for Rs. 400 and sells them at Rs. 50 each. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 800 and offers a discount of 25%. If he makes a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 720, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an article at a profit of 10%. If the cost price and selling price are both increased by Rs. 50, the profit percentage becomes 8%. What is the original cost price?
A shopkeeper buys an article for Rs. 300 and sells it for Rs. 360. What is his profit percentage?
A man sells an article for Rs. 450 at a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper sells two articles for Rs. 500 each, one at a profit of 20% and the other at a loss of 20%. What is the overall profit or loss percentage?
A trader buys an article for Rs. 400 and marks it up by 50%. After offering a discount of 20%, what is his profit percentage?
By selling an article for Rs. 300, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 25%. What is the cost price?
A man buys 15 apples for Rs. 60 and sells them at Rs. 5 each. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a profit of 30%. If the cost price is Rs. 200, what is the selling price?
A trader sells an article at a loss of 10%. If he had sold it for Rs. 45 more, he would have gained 5%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 600 and offers a discount of 10%. If he makes a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 800, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 25%. What is the cost price?
A man buys an article for Rs. 500 and sells it for Rs. 600. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a loss of 20%. If the selling price is Rs. 400, what is the cost price?
A trader buys an article for Rs. 300 and sells it for Rs. 360. If he had sold it for Rs. 330, what would be his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article for Rs. 450 and makes a profit of 12.5%. What is the cost price?
A man buys 20 pencils for Rs. 40 and sells them at Rs. 2.5 each. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 1000 and offers a discount of 20%. If he makes a profit of 25%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 360, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an article at a profit of 15%. If the cost price is Rs. 400, what is the selling price?
A shopkeeper sells two articles for Rs. 600 each, one at a profit of 20% and the other at a loss of 20%. What is the overall profit or loss percentage?
A man buys an article for Rs. 200 and sells it for Rs. 250. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 500 and offers a discount of 10%. If he makes a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 720, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an article at a loss of 15%. If he had sold it for Rs. 60 more, he would have gained 5%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper buys an article for Rs. 400 and sells it for Rs. 480. What is his profit percentage?
A man buys 10 kg of rice for Rs. 300 and sells it at Rs. 35 per kg. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article for Rs. 450 and makes a profit of 12.5%. What is the cost price?
A trader marks an article at Rs. 800 and offers a discount of 25%. If he makes a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 360, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a profit of 15%. If the cost price is Rs. 400, what is the selling price?
A man buys an article for Rs. 500 and sells it for Rs. 600. If he had sold it for Rs. 550, what would be his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper sells an article for Rs. 720 and makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price?
A trader sells an article at a loss of 10%. If the selling price is Rs. 450, what is the cost price?
A shopkeeper buys 12 oranges for Rs. 48 and sells them at Rs. 5 each. What is his profit percentage?
A shopkeeper marks an article at Rs. 1000 and offers a discount of 20%. If he makes a profit of 25%, what is the cost price?
By selling an article for Rs. 360, a shopkeeper incurs a loss of 10%. What is the cost price?
Two articles were sold for ₹3,000 each, with no loss and profit in the entire transaction. If one was sold at a profit of 25%, then the loss incurred on the second article is ____.
The selling price of 80 items is equal to the cost price of 72 items. What is the percentage of loss incurred in the transaction?
A dealer advertises that he sales his goods at cost price. But he uses 950 gm for 1 kg weight. Find his gain or loss percentage.
A shopkeeper bought 30 books and sold 25 books for same price. What percentage had he gained or lost?

A shopkeeper claims to sell 450 kg rice at a cost price of ₹40 per kg but uses a weight of 900 grams instead of a one kilogram weight. He makes a profit of ₹2,520 by selling the remaining rice in the black market. The ratio of the black-market price to the original price per kg of rice is:
Profit and Loss.comment: Profit from 450 kg at 900g = 450 × 40 × 0.1 = 1800, Black market profit = 2520 - 1800 = 720, Black market price = 720 / 12.86 ≈ 56, Ratio = 56 : 40 = 7 : 5.

Profit and Loss.question: A vendor buys 20 pens for ₹15 and sells them at 15 for ₹20. How many pens should be bought and sold to earn a profit of ₹245?
Profit and Loss.comment: CP per pen = 15 / 20 = 0.75, SP per pen = 20 / 15 ≈ 1.33, Profit per pen = 0.58, Pens = 245 / 0.58 ≈ 420.

Profit and Loss.question: A shopkeeper normally makes a profit of 20% in a certain transaction; he weighed 900 gm instead of 1 kg due to an error in the weighing machine. If he charges 15% less than what he normally charges, then what is his actual profit or loss percentage?

A dealer buys an article listed at ₹250 and gets successive discounts of 12% and 16%. He spends 10% of the cost price on transportation. At what price should he sell the article to earn a profit of 25%? (Correct to two places of decimal)
Sukrit purchased an item for ₹650 and sold it at a profit of 26%. At what price (in ₹) did Sukrit sell the item?

The percentage profit earned by selling an article for ₹2,100 is equal to the percentage loss incurred by selling the same article for ₹1,460. At what price should the article be sold to make 20% profit?
Sohan sells sugar at cost price but he uses faulty weight and thus earns a profit of 28%. How many g (grams) of sugar is he giving in exchange of 3.2 kg of sugar?
The cost of 4 chairs and 3 tables is ₹2,100 and the cost of 5 chairs and 2 tables is ₹1,750. Find the cost (in ₹) of a chair.

A dishonest shopkeeper sells rice at a cost price but makes a 25% profit by using faulty weights. He decides to give a discount to attract more customers. What percent of discount should he offer to make 10% profit?

B purchased 15 kg apples at the rate of ₹180 per kg from a wholesaler who uses a weight of 950 grams for the kg weight. B sold all these apples at ₹180 per kg but used a weight of 750 grams for the kg weight. Find the percentage profit earned by B in the transaction (correct to 2 places of decimal).
The cost of 2 pencils and 3 pens is ₹55 and the cost of 7 pencils and 2 pens is ₹65. What is the total price (in ₹) of one pen and one pencil?

The first shirt is sold at twice the selling price of the second shirt. The first shirt is sold at 8% profit and the second shirt is sold at a 3% loss. What is the overall percentage profit on the shirts (Rounded off to two decimal place)?

Sukhvir purchased some perishable items for sale but 30% of those items could not be sold and went bad. However, Sukhvir managed to sell the rest of the items at a price that helped him earn an overall profit of 19%. At what percentage above the cost price of each item purchased by Sukhvir did he sell each of the items that did not go bad?

Aditya sold article X at a profit of 23% and article Y at a loss of 13%. He earned a profit of ₹180 in the entire transaction. If article X costs ₹90 less than article Y, then what is the price of article Y (in ₹)?

A vendor marked the selling price of a table at ₹5,670 after adding 35% profit to its cost price. Since the sale was very low at this price level, he decided to sell the table with 12% profit. Find the new selling price (in ₹).

The cost of pulses is 12% less than the selling price. Using a faulty weighing machine, shopkeeper is able to earn 25% profit. How much percent of the faulty machine shows more weight as compared to the actual weight (Rounded off to the nearest integer)?
Arvind has 650 kg of wheat. A part of which he sells at 9% profit and the rest at 19% profit to get 15% profit on the whole. What is the quantity (in kg) of wheat sold by Arvind at 9% profit?

A shopkeeper sells sugar at ₹40 per kg, which he purchased at ₹36 per kg. His weighing machine is faulty and it weighs only 800 gm while selling. His percentage profit (correct to 2 decimal places) is:

Ankita sold three toys. The first toy was sold for ₹1,500 at a profit of 25%; the second toy was sold for ₹2,800 at a loss of 50% and the third toy was sold for ₹3,500 at a profit of 25%. Find her total profit or loss percentage.
By selling a TV set for ₹16,800, a salesman gains a profit of 20%. If the production cost is increased by 20%, find the new selling price of the set so as to gain 20%.
A man sold his cycle at 17% loss. If he had sold it for 1,056 more, he would have made 5% profit. The cost price of the cycle is:

A company buys raw materials for ₹10,000 and manufactures a product that costs an additional ₹5,000 in labour and overhead. The product is sold to a distributor for ₹25,000, who marks it up by 20% and sells it to a retailer. The retailer then marks it up by another 25% and sells it to the end customer. What is the overall percentage profit made by the company, distributor, and retailer combined?

A medical store owner purchased medicines worth ₹18,000 from a company. He sold 2/5 part of the medicine at a 35% loss. On which gain, he should sell the rest of the medicines so that he has neither gain nor loss?

Praveen sells a study table to Zoya at a loss of 10%, and Zoya sells the study table to Aadarsh at a profit of 25%. If Aadarsh purchased the study table for ₹2,250, then what was the cost (in ₹) of the study table for Praveen?
Profit and Loss.comment: CP for Zoya = 2250 / 1.25 = 1800, CP for Praveen = 1800 / 0.9 = 2000.

Profit and Loss.question: A dishonest shopkeeper professes to sell grains at the cost price, but he uses a weight of 920 gm for 1 kg weight. Find his gain percentage (round up to two decimal places).
If a man purchases kismis at ₹320 per kg and sells it at ₹6 per 25 grams. then his profit/loss percentage is:
The market price of cupboard is ₹15,750, which is 50% above its cost price. It is sold at a discount of 40%. What is the profit/loss percentage?

A tailor buys lining clothes from a wholesale merchant and cheats him by using a measurement tape which is 5 cm longer than the normal tape. The tailor offer the customer at cost price while stitching different garments and uses measurement tape which is 5 cm shorter than the normal tape . The gain per cent is:

A person purchased ten boxes of grapes at a cost of ₹2,000 per box. Each box contained 20 kgs of grapes. He sold each box at the rate of ₹2,500 per box. But on the whole 10 kgs of grapes were damaged. Further he paid ₹1,000 as a transport charges. Find his gain or loss.
By selling a watch for ₹1600, a person gets profit is equal to the loss of selling the same watch for ₹1400. If the person wants to get a profit of 20%, at what price should he sell the watch?

A shopkeeper bought certain number of apples for ₹3,600. He sold one-fifth of them at a loss of 10%, one-fourth of the remaining apples at a loss of 5% and two-thirds of the rest at a profit of 15%. At what price should he sell the remaining apples to earn a profit of 27% overall?

A dishonest trader marks up his goods by 50% and then allows a discount of 20% on its marked price. Additionally, he uses a faulty scale which measures 900 gm. for 1 kg. What will be his net profit percentage (rounded off to the nearest integer)?

A vendor bought two items. The cost price of first item is ₹500 and second item is ₹600. He sold the first item at a profit of 10% and second item at a loss of 5%. Find his overall profit or loss percentage?
A dishonest dealer sells his goods at a profit of 20% but uses a weight which is 10% less than the actual weight. His net profit percentage is:

A vegetable vendor bought 100 kg of potatoes at the rate of ₹19 per kg and spent ₹100 as cartage. He sold 60 kg of potatoes at a profit of 50% and half of the remaining stock at a profit of 40%. He sold half of the still remaining potatoes at a profit of 25%. What profit percentage should he aim for when selling the ultimate remaining potatoes to achieve an overall profit of 42%?
A trader sells an article at 16% below its cost price. Had he sold it for ₹192.20 more, he would have gained 15%. The new selling price (in ₹) of the article is:

The cost price of two articles is equal. One article is sold at a profit of 12% and the other article for ₹3,600 more than the first. If the net profit is 15 27/51%, then what is the cost price of each article?
A dishonest dealer sells an article at a 10% loss on the cost price but uses a weight of 40 gm instead of 50 gm. What is his percentage of profit?
A person bought two buffaloes for ₹11,520. One is sold at a loss of 15% and the other is sold at a gain of 19%. If the selling price of both buffaloes is equal, find the cost price of the first one.
A shopkeeper sold 3 wristwatches for ₹2,800 each. If he has sold the watches with 40%, 25% and 12% profit, respectively, then find his overall profit percentage (correct to 2 decimal places).
A dishonest dealer claims to sell his products at 24% loss on the cost price but uses 100 g weight instead of 200 g weight. His profit percentage is:
Reyan purchased a laptop for ₹56,000 and a scanner-cum-printer for ₹22,000. He sold the laptop for a 20% profit and the scanner-cum-printer for a 15% profit. What is his profit percentage?
A wrist watch was purchased for ₹3,000 and sold for ₹3,500. Find the profit percentage.
A shopkeeper sells goods at 82% loss on cost price but uses 28% less weight. What is his percentage profit or loss?
A man sells a cow for ₹22,000 and gains 10%. At what price should he sell the same cow, in order to gain 14%?
A shopkeeper purchased groundnuts at ₹64/kg and sells at ₹80/kg. While selling, he uses faulty weights and gives 800 gm instead of 1 kg. Find his actual profit percentage.
By selling a hair oil product for ₹336, the gain is 12%. If the gain is reduced to 9%, find the resultant selling price (in ₹).
The price of an item is increased by 15% and then the price is decreased by 12%. What is the effective percentage increase in the price of item?
An old HP Deskjet printer was bought for ₹4,800 and ₹500 was spent on its repair. If it was sold for ₹6,360, then its profit percentage is.
A vendor buys 20 laptop bags for ₹13,000 and sells them at 15 for ₹10,125. How many laptop bags should be bought and sold to earn a profit of ₹3,225?
Profit and Loss.comment: CP per bag = 13000 / 20 = 650, SP per bag = 10125 / 15 = 675, Profit per bag = 25, Bags = 3225 / 25 = 129.

Profit and Loss.question: On two items of equal prices, T gets 12% profit on one item and incurs 8% loss on other. What is his overall profit or loss percentage?
Profit and Loss.comment: Total CP = 2X, SP1 = X × 1.12, SP2 = X × 0.92, Total SP = 2.04X, Profit % = (2.04X - 2X) / 2X × 100 = 2%.

Square Root.question: When all the students of a school are made to stand in lines to form a square, less than 10 students are left surplus. If the students of the school are 1230, how many students will stand on each line?
Square Root.comment: Largest perfect square ≤ 1230 with remainder < 10 is 1225 = 35², 1230 − 1225 = 5 < 10. So, 35 per line.

Square Root.question: The square of a natural number subtracted from its cube is 48. The number is ______.
Square Root.comment: Let number be n. Solve n³ − n² = 48. For n = 4: 4³ = 64, 4² = 16, 64 − 16 = 48.

Square Root.question: What is the least perfect square number which is exactly divisible by 3, 4, 7, 10, and 12?
What is the least number to be subtracted from 696 to make it a perfect square?
What is the least number to be added to 4523 to make it a perfect square?
If √14.44 + √(9 + x²) = 8.8, then find the value of x.
What is the square root of 9 + 2√14?
If x = √(3018 + √(36 + √169)), then what is the value of x?
The square root of 27225 is ______.
The number of non-square numbers between 87² and 88² is ______.
Square Root.comment: Numbers between n² and (n+1)² = 2n. For n = 87, 2×87 = 174.

Square Root.question: Square root of 0.9 is equal to ______.
What is the square root of 5041?
Which of the numbers given below is the square root of 16384?
The square root of which of the following numbers is irrational?
What is the square root of 9409?
Which of the numbers given below is the square root of 15376?
The square root of which of the following is a rational number?
The square root of which of the following is a rational number?
The square root of 27 − 4√35 is ______.
A two-digit number has its tens digit as 4 less than thrice the units digit. If the units and tens digits are interchanged, its value decreases by 18. Find the square root of the two-digit number?
Square Root.comment: Let units = u, tens = t. t = 3u − 4, 10u + t = 10t + u − 18. Solve: u = t − 2, t = 5, u = 3. Number = 53, √53 ≈ 7.28.

Square Root.question: The square roots of how many factors of 2250 will be natural numbers?
Square Root.comment: 2250 = 2×3²×5³. Total factors = 24. Square factors: 1, 9, 25, 225 (even exponents), so 4.

Square Root.question: What is the square root of 214 − 78√5?
The least perfect square, which is divisible by each of 21, 36, and 66 is ______.
Find the square root of 289.
Find the square root of 0.
Find the square root of 121.
Find the square root of 256.
Find the square root of 169.
Find the square root of 49.
Find the square root of 25.
Find the square root of 196.
Find the square root of 9.
Find the square root of 100.
Find the value of √0.64 + √1.44 + √0.0009.
Which is the smallest number, with which 600 should be multiplied so that it becomes a perfect square?
In a class, each student contributed as many paise as the number of students. If the total collection was Rs. 169, what was the number of students?
A person wants to arrange his colleagues in the form of a perfect square, but finds there are 9 persons too many. What will be the number of persons in the front row, if the total number is 2410?
An army man wants to arrange his men in a perfect square, but finds there are 64 men too many. What will be the number of men in the front row, if the total number is 15440?
How many natural numbers lie between 9² and 10²?
Square Root.comment: Between n² and (n+1)²: 2n numbers. For n = 9, 2×9 = 18.

Square Root.question: Which of the following is a perfect square number?
Find the perfect square number between 30 and 40.
Without doing any calculation, find the numbers which are surely perfect squares.
Square Root.comment: Squares cannot end in 2,3,7,8. 441 ends in 1, 21² = 441.

Square Root.question: Without adding, find the sum 1 + 3 + 5 + 7 + 9.
Square Root.comment: Sum of first n odd numbers = n². For 5 odds, 5² = 25.

Square Root.question: The square root of 16641 is ______.
Find the greatest perfect square of 5 digits.
None of the square numbers end with _________ at unit’s place.
If 5278 is squared, then what will be at unit place?
Square Root.comment: Units digit of 5278 is 8, 8² = 64, units digit = 4.

Square Root.question: Find the greatest 4-digit number which is a perfect square.
How many numbers lie between square of 12 and 13.
Square Root.comment: Between n² and (n+1)²: 2n numbers. For n = 12, 2×12 = 24.

Square Root.question: 2025 plants are to be planted in a garden such that each row contains as many plants as the number of rows. Find the number of plants in each row.
